thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger told Anthony Taylor to fuck off twice | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger told Anthony Taylor to fuck off twice | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger told Anthony Taylor to fuck off twice | Metro News
text:
Follow us REVEALED: Exactly what Arsene Wenger said to the fourth official that saw him slapped with four-game ban Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:07 am Arsene Wenger is sent to the stands by referee Jonathan Moss as fourth official Anthony Taylor looks on (Getty) 
Arsene Wenger told fourth official Anthony Taylor to ‘f*** off’ twice amid the incident that saw the Arsenal manager banned from the touchline. 
Wenger became incensed during the Gunners’ Premier League meeting with Burnley last month, which led to him launching a tirade at the match officials and pushing Taylor after being sent to the stands. 
The FA came down hard on the 67-year-old Frenchman, issuing him with a four-game touchline ban. 
The full written reasons for the ban have been released, in which Taylor gave his account. 
‘Following the award of a penalty kick against his team in approx. 92nd min, Mr Wenger left his technical area to confront me in disagreement at the decision. Before he said anything I said: “Think carefully before you say anything.” Wenger was forced to watch four games from the stands (Getty) 
‘He responded by saying “you are dishonest to your federation.” I considered this to be questioning both mine and the referee, Jon Moss’s integrity and impartiality. I stated to Mr. Wenger that such a comment was not acceptable and he told me to “f*** off” on two separate occasions.’ Arsenal fixtures 
Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Lincoln – FA Cup (H) – 11/12 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr Crystal Palace (A) – Sat 8 Apr
